SEARCH
Package webx

Class WebXElement

java.lang.Object
webx.WebXElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
Area, Br, Col, Embed, Hr, Img, Input, Param, Path, Source, Track, WebXContainerElement
public abstract class WebXElement extends Object
Represents a basic HTML element. All UI Nodes extend this.

    • hxVals

      public WebXElement hxVals(String val)
      The hx-vals attribute allows you to add to the parameters that will be submitted with an AJAX request.
      Parameters:
      val -
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs 
         
 	new P()
 		.hxVals("{\"myVal\": 100}");
 	new P()
 		.hxVals("js:{\"compute\": 100 * 5 * somevar}");

    • hxTrigger

      public WebXElement hxTrigger(String trigger)
      The hx-trigger attribute allows you to specify what triggers an AJAX request.
      Parameters:
      trigger -
      Returns:
      See Also:
      • htmx docs 
         
 	new P("00:00:00")
 		.hxPost("/get_clock")
 		.hxTrigger("every 1s");

    • hxTarget

      public WebXElement hxTarget(String target)
      The hx-target attribute allows you to target a different element for swapping than the one issuing the AJAX request.
      Parameters:
      trigger -
      Returns:
      See Also:
      • htmx docs 
         
 	new Button("Click Me")
 		.hxPost("/greet)
 		.hxTarget("#parentdiv");

    • hxSwap

      public WebXElement hxSwap(String target)
      The hx-swap attribute allows you to specify how the response will be swapped in relative to the target of an AJAX request. If you do not specify the option, the default is htmx.config.defaultSwapStyle (innerHTML).
      Parameters:
      trigger -
      Returns:
      See Also:
      • htmx docs 
         
 	new Button("Click Me")
 		.hxPost("/greet)
 		.hxSwap("outerHTML");
